description: From a series of five lithographs for Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse) by Leo Tolstoy, published by Karl Lang Verlag in Darmstadt, 1919; housed in a beige portfolio case with a gray binding; figure on left dressed in black stands behind a table with a glass and bottle on it; his arms are raised at his side; another figure in the lower right corner sits with a glass in front of him and his hand resting on the corner of the table
portfolio: From Plate 4 from Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse), Leo Tolstoy, published by Karl Lang Verlag in Darmstadt, 1919
signed: LR in pencil, below image: Walter Gramatté
title: Fedja and Pjetuschkoff, Plate 4 from Der Lebende Leichnam (The Living Corpse)
